Certificate request password:

choices.D: UCS-A# scope security UCS-A /security # scope keyring kr2016 UCS-A /security/keyring # create certreq ip 10.68.68.68 subject-name sjc2016 UCS-A /security/keyring* # commit-buffer
choices.C: UCS-B# scope security UCS-B /security # scope keyring kr2016 UCS-B /security/keyring # set certreq 10.68.68.68 sjc2016 UCS-B /security/keyring* # commit-both

questions.question_text:
An engineer has a primary fabric that is named UCS-A and a secondary fabric that is named UCS-B. A certificate request that has a subject name of sjc2016 for a keyring that is named kr2016 needs to be created. The cluster IP address is 10.68.68.68.
Which command set creates this certificate request?

A company provides applications and database hosting services to multiple customers using isolated infrastructure-as-a-service services within the same data center environment. The environment is based on Cisco MDS 9000 Series Switches. The requirement is to manage the environment by using Fibre Channel
Security Protocol and to enable user authentication when the centralized AAA server is unreachable. All communication between the MDS switches and the remote servers must be encrypted. Which command set must be used to meet these requirements?

choices.D: aaa group server tacacs+ TacacsServer1 aaa authentication login console TacacsServer1
choices.A: aaa group server radius RadiusServer1 aaa authentication login default RadiusServer1
choices.C: aaa group server radius RadiusServer1 aaa authentication dhchap default group RadiusServer1
choices.B: aaa group server tacacs+ TacacsServer1 aaa authentication dhchap default group TacacsServer1

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
It has to be B. FC-SP uses DHCHAP protocol for authenticating authentication between MDS9000 and other devices could potencially use both tacacs and radius. However, bcs it tells us all 
communication between them should be encrypted, only TACACS provides full AAA encryption.
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/switches/datacenter/mds9000/sw/8_x/config/security/cisco_mds9000_security_config_guide_8x/configuring_fcsp_dhchap.html#con_1247118

Selected Answer: B
b is the one

comments.content:
RADIUS only encrypts the password, whereas with TACACS, all communications are encrypted.
Also, DHCHAP is the protocol used if using FC-SP (fibre-channel security protocol) is required.
Therefore, B is correct.

discussion.content:
any reference for this?
Why is it not A or C?

questions.question_text:
A customer undergoes an IT security review assessment. The auditor must have read-only access to the Cisco Nexus 9000 Series Switch to perform the configuration review. The customer implements this security role for the auditor: role name audit rule 1 permit command * rule 2 - Output omitted -- username auditor password C4SAFF1B05EB1968$c0 role audit
Which configuration snippet must complete the configuration?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A is the one!

Selected Answer: A
deny configure terminal

Before you begin
If you want to distribute the user role configuration, enable user role configuration distribution on all Cisco NX-OS devices to which you want the configuration distributed.

SUMMARY STEPS
configure terminal
role name role-name
rule number {deny | permit} command command-string
rule number {deny | permit} {read | read-write}
rule number {deny | permit} {read | read-write} feature feature-name
rule number {deny | permit} {read | read-write} feature-group group-name
rule number {deny | permit} {read | read-write} oid snmp_oid_name
(Optional) description text
exit

choices.D: n7k-1(config)# ip dhcp snooping verify n7k-1(config)# vlan configuration 10 n7k-1(config-vlan)# ip dhcp snooping trust
choices.B: n7k-1(config)# ip dhcp snooping verify n7k-1(config)# interface Ethernet2/4 n7k-1(config-if)# ip dhcp snooping verify vlan 10
choices.C: n7k-1(config)# ip dhcp snooping vlan 10 n7k-1(config)# interface Ethernet2/4 n7k-1(config-if)# ip dhcp snooping trust
choices.A: n7k-1(config)# ip dhcp snooping vlan 10 n7k-1(config)# interface Ethernet2/4 n7k-1(config-if)# ip dhcp snooping verify vlan 10

questions.question_text:
An engineer must implement a solution that prevents untrusted DHCP servers from compromising the network. The feature must be configured on a Cisco Nexus
7000 Series Switch and applied to VLAN 10. The legitimate DHCP servers are connected to interface Ethernet 2/4. Which configuration set must be used to meet these requirements?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B is the one

questions.question_text:
An engineer implements a Cisco UCS C-Series Server that must adhere to these security requirements:
✑ Unencrypted communication must be disabled.
✑ The session timeout must not exceed 15 minutes.
✑ Unencrypted traffic must be automatically diverted.
✑ CLI-based management must use nondefault ports.
Which configuration set meets these requirements?
questions.answer_description: Only choice B meets all the requirements given of timing out in 15 minutes (900 seconds). Redirecting HTTP to HTTPS, and using a non-default SSH port.

choices.B: HTTP Port: 80 / HTTPS Port: 443 Session Timeout: 900 Redirect HTTP to HTTPS Enabled SSH Port: 2022
choices.D: XML API Enabled HTTP Port: 8080 / HTTPS Port: 8443 IPMI over LAN Enabled Randomized Encryption Key
choices.A: SSH Enabled SSH Port: 8022 SSH Timeout: 1200 IPMI over LAN Enabled
choices.C: Redfish Enabled checked Redfish Port: 443 SSH Enabled checked HTTPS Port: 8443
